content.description:
P1. Climb a steep, vibrating column to a vertical ice covered wall, which eases off after another 10m or so. Continue up mostly WI4 to a belay on the right.  70m WI6 R
P2. Climb a long pitch of good ice to another belay on the right.  65m WI4
P3. Climb a steep right-leaning ice-filled slot to the top. 35m WI4

Full Cup is on the far left side of the cirque, about 10m right of the Cerca Del Mar route. While the thinking is that routes on the far left are less exposed to serac hazard than those further right, this is doubtful.  There are seracs hundreds of meters above that threaten the far left side, they just can’t be seen from below.
Screws

The Stutfeld Glacier cirque is a wild and active place!  Wind, snow, spindrift, avalanches, and serac collapse are all common here. There are no ‘safe’ routes in the cirque, beware. Never the less, this is truly a beautiful place, with many ribbons of ice hundreds of meters long, streaming from deep blue seracs.  If you must climb here, we get it, but move fast. And if it doesn’t feel right, turn around.
